metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2116 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the jas_iccprof_createfrombuf function in JasPer 1.900.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted ICC color profile in a JPEG 2000 image file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.3
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jasper package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-14ubuntu3.3').
